intro: Astranthium mimum, commonly known as the lesser starwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and along stream banks, thriving in temperate climates. Its small, star-shaped flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces achenes as its seeds. Astranthium mimum is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in some agricultural settings.
